answerText: Gustav von Aschenbach [accept either][10] Gustav von Aschenbach becomes obsessed with the boy Tadzio and catches cholera on his vacation in this novella by Thomas Mann.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | 8 | 21 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This writer's genius is borne of discipline and calculated to be impressive but always palatable. For ten points each: [10] Name this Munich resident, the author of masterpieces like Maia and The Abject, as well as a prose epic about Frederick the Great.
